Selecting the file storage
File storage is a system designed for storing, organizing, and managing files.
The file storage is selected in the
registry
of the "File storage" [FS_STORAGE] type. The basic delivery assumes the following set of directories:
Storage settings
To define a directory for file storage, the user needs to open the required storage object and activate the "Default" flag.
The "Default" flag can be active for only one registry object. After saving an object with this flag enabled, it will be automatically disabled in the previously selected object.
The user running the application must have read and write permissions for the specified directory.
After applying the settings, it is necessary to update the application cache. Otherwise, the system will continue using the previous configuration value.
If needed, the user can specify storage configuration parameters, which depend on the selected directory. Some of these parameters are listed in the table below:
Setting
Purpose
File storage URL
Path to the folder containing the storage files.
Move to storage when replacing content
When the file content is replaced, it will be moved to the specified storage.
Delete files permanently
When the parameterâ€™s switch is active, if the file is deleted from the registry or from the object, it will be deleted from the storage with no possibility of recovery.
Description
Description of the storage object.
Default
Setting the configurable object as the default storage.
File storage S3
To use the File storage S3, the user needs to:
Specify the connection parameters to the S3 service in the
application configuration file
.
Select the "File storage S3" instance as the default file storage.
To move files previously saved in the database to the S3 storage, the
migrateFile
function can be used.
Composite Storage
Composite storage allows the fault-tolerant file storage across multiple data centers (DCs).
To use the storage, follow these steps:
Form the storage composition.
To do this, open the "Composite storage" object. In the object profile, within the "File storage package" registry control panel, click the
button and configure the parameters in the opened profile:
Setting
Purpose
File Storage
Select the file storage to be added to the composite storage.
The selection is made from objects of "File Storage" [FS_STORAGE] type (excluding the composite storage itself).
Order
A number defining the priority of the selected file storage within the composite storage.
Activate the "Default" flag.
The storage composition must contain at least one directory.
